intro: Espeletia marcanoana, commonly known as the Marcanoan heather, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, adapted to attract pollinators in high-altitude environments. It is well-suited to rocky and arid conditions, showcasing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in the biodiversity of the Andean ecosystems.
